testcase.system-out:
Story: Create Generators
As a Developer I want to create my own generators So that I can customize them to my needs
Scenario: Create a minimal do-nothing generator
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Minimal Generator.generator" And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Minimal Generator.generator/templates.txt" (FAILED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the "Minimal Generator" generator listed on the "Select a Generator" dialog (NOT PERFORMED)
Scenario: Create a generator which just generates a file on the specified location
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Plain File.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Plain File.generator/templates/PlainFile.txt" with contents: Plain Text File!!! (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Plain File.generator/templates.txt" with contents: templates/PlainFile.txt=Plain File.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Plain File" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "Plain File.txt" generated with content: Plain Text File!!! (NOT PERFORMED)

testcase.system-out:
Story: Set params for generators
As a I Developer I want to parameterize my generators So that I can generate dynamic content
Scenario: Set params for a generator
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Parameterized.generator" And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Parameterized.generator/templates.txt" (FAILED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Parameterized.generator/params.txt" with contents: someParam (NOT PERFORMED) And I open the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Parameterized" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the "Configure Params" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the "someParam" parameter to fill (NOT PERFORMED)
Scenario: Set default values to params
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/ParameterizedWithDefaultValue.generator" And I create the templates configuration file "generators/ParameterizedWithDefaultValue.generator/templates.txt" (FAILED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/ParameterizedWithDefaultValue.generator/params.txt" with contents: someParam=someDefaultValue (NOT PERFORMED) And I open the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "ParameterizedWithDefaultValue" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the "Configure Params" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the "someParam" parameter to fill (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the "someParam" value already filled with "someDefaultValue" (NOT PERFORMED)

testcase.system-out:
Story: Choose files that will be generated
As a Developer I want to choose the files that will be generated So that I can avoid generation of the ones I don't need
Scenario: Choose files that will be generated
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Multiple Files Generator.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Multiple Files Generator.generator/templates/File1.txt" (FAILED) And I create the template file "generators/Multiple Files Generator.generator/templates/File2.txt" (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Multiple Files Generator.generator/templates.txt" with contents: templates/File1.txt=File1.txt templates/File2.txt=File2.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Multiple Files Generator" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I click "Next" on the "Configure Params" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I uncheck the file "templates/File2.txt" on the "Customize Generation" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "File1.txt" generated (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see not the file "File2.txt" generated (NOT PERFORMED)

testcase.system-out:
Story: Use template engines
As a Developer I want to use template engines I know So that I have them processed
Scenario: Use Freemarker on .ftl files
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator using Freemarker.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator using Freemarker.generator/templates/FreemarkerTemplate.txt.ftl" with contents: ${"processed"?capitalize} by ${engine} (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator using Freemarker.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/FreemarkerTemplate.txt.ftl=${engine} template.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator using Freemarker.generator/params.ftl" with contents: engine=${"freemarker"?capitalize} (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator using Freemarker" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "Freemarker template.txt" generated with content: Processed by Freemarker (NOT PERFORMED)
Scenario: Use Velocity on .vm files
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator using Velocity.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator using Velocity.generator/templates/VelocityTemplate.txt.vm" with contents: Processed by $engine.toLowerCase() (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator using Velocity.generator/templates.vm" with contents: templates/VelocityTemplate.txt.vm=$engine.toLowerCase() template.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator using Velocity.generator/params.vm" with contents: engine=#set($text='Velocity')$text.toUpperCase() (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator using Velocity" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "velocity template.txt" generated with content: Processed by velocity (NOT PERFORMED)
Scenario: Use Groovy on .groovy files
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator using Groovy.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator using Groovy.generator/templates/GroovyTemplate.txt.groovy" with contents: Processed by <%=engine.toLowerCase()%> (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator using Groovy.generator/templates.groovy" with contents: templates/GroovyTemplate.txt.groovy=<%=engine.toLowerCase()%> template.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator using Groovy.generator/params.groovy" with contents: engine=<%="Groovy".toUpperCase()%> (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator using Groovy" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "groovy template.txt" generated with content: Processed by groovy (NOT PERFORMED)
Scenario: Use no engine on .txt files
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator using no Template.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator using no Template.generator/templates/unprocessed.txt" with contents: Processed by <%=engine.toLowerCase()%> (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator using no Template.generator/templates.txt" with contents: templates/unprocessed.txt=unprocessed.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator using no Template.generator/params.txt" with contents: engine=<%="no Template".toUpperCase()%> (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator using no Template" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "unprocessed.txt" generated with content: Processed by <%=engine.toLowerCase()%> (NOT PERFORMED)

testcase.system-out:
Story: Set params for generation
As a Developer I want to change the generator params So that it generates the dynamic content I need
Scenario: Set params for generation
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator with param.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator with param.generator/templates/Generatorwithparam.txt.ftl" with contents: ${parameter1} ${parameter2} (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator with param.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/Generatorwithparam.txt.ftl=Generator with param.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator with param.generator/params.ftl" with contents: parameter1 parameter2 (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator with param" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I set the param "parameter1" value to "Parameter 1" (NOT PERFORMED) And I set the param "parameter2" value to "Parameter 2" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "Generator with param.txt" generated with content: Parameter 1 Parameter 2 (NOT PERFORMED)
Scenario: Set a processed param for generation
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator with param.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator with param.generator/templates/Generatorwithparam.txt.ftl" with contents: ${parameter1} ${parameter2} (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator with param.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/Generatorwithparam.txt.ftl=Generator with param.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator with param.generator/params.ftl" with contents: parameter1 parameter2 (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator with param" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I set the param "parameter1" value to "Parameter 1" (NOT PERFORMED) And I set the param "parameter2" value to "${parameter1?upper_case}" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "Generator with param.txt" generated with content: Parameter 1 PARAMETER 1 (NOT PERFORMED)

testcase.system-out:
Story: Preview the output
As a Developer I want to preview the output of generators So that I know what will be generated
Scenario: Preview the processed output
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator for previewing.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator for previewing.generator/templates/TemplateForPreviewing.txt.ftl" with contents: ${param1} Content of the template (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator for previewing.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/TemplateForPreviewing.txt.ftl=Template for previewing.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator for previewing.generator/params.ftl" with contents: param1 (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator for previewing" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I set the param "param1" value to "Processed" (NOT PERFORMED) And I click "Next" on the "Configure Params" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I click "Preview" on the template "templates/TemplateForPreviewing.txt.ftl" (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the "Preview" dialog with content: Processed Content of the template (NOT PERFORMED)
Scenario: Preview and change the output
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator for change on preview.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator for change on preview.generator/templates/TemplateForChangeOnPreview.txt.ftl" with contents: Original Content of the template (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator for change on preview.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/TemplateForChangeOnPreview.txt.ftl=Template for change on preview.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator for change on preview" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I click "Next" on the "Configure Params" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I click "Preview" on the template "templates/TemplateForChangeOnPreview.txt.ftl" (NOT PERFORMED) And I change the output content on the "Preview" dialog to: Changed Content of the template (NOT PERFORMED) And I click "OK" on the "Preview" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "Template for change on preview.txt" generated with content: Changed Content of the template (NOT PERFORMED)

Story: Use global params
As a Developer I want to use global default params So that I don't need to specify them in each generator
Scenario: Use global params
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator using global params.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator using global params.generator/templates/GeneratorUsingGlobalParams.txt.ftl" with contents: ${param1} (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator using global params.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/GeneratorUsingGlobalParams.txt.ftl=Generator using global params.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator using global params.generator/params.ftl" with contents: param1=${param1!"Generator Param"} (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the global params configuration file "generators/params.ftl" with contents: param1=Global Param (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator using global params" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "Generator using global params.txt" generated with content: Global Param (NOT PERFORMED)

testcase.system-out:
Story: Params referencing other params
As a Developer I want to have each param value processed by declaration order So that I can reference and process previous params values
Scenario: Params referencing other params
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator with Params.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator with Params.generator/templates/GeneratedFile.txt.ftl" with contents: ${processedParam} (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator with Params.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/GeneratedFile.txt.ftl=Generated File.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Generator with Params.generator/params.ftl" with contents: referencedParam=referenced param processedParam=${referencedParam?capitalize} (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator with Params" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "Generated File.txt" generated with content: Referenced Param (NOT PERFORMED)

Story: Set templates to be generated
As a Developer I want to set the templates to be generated So that the plugin processes and generates them on the right place
Scenario: Set templates to be generated
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Generator with templates.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Generator with templates.generator/templates/Templatetobegenerated.txt.ftl" (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Generator with templates.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/Templatetobegenerated.txt.ftl=Destination.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Generator with templates" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I click "Next" on the "Configure Params" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the "Customize Generation" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the template "templates/Templatetobegenerated.txt.ftl" listed (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the template "templates/Templatetobegenerated.txt.ftl" destination set to "Destination.txt" (NOT PERFORMED)

testcase.system-out:
Story: Create composite generators
As a Developer I want to compose generators So that I can use them together or separately
Scenario: Create composite generators
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Composite Generator.generator" And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Composite Generator.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: NestedGenerator.generator (FAILED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Composite Generator.generator/params.txt" with contents: commonParam=Composite value compositeParam (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the generator folder "generators/Composite Generator.generator/NestedGenerator.generator" (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the template file "generators/Composite Generator.generator/NestedGenerator.generator/templates/Nestedgenerator.ftl" with contents: ${commonParam} (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Composite Generator.generator/NestedGenerator.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/Nestedgenerator.ftl=NestedGenerator.txt (NOT PERFORMED) And I create the params configuration file "generators/Composite Generator.generator/NestedGenerator.generator/params.txt" with contents: commonParam=Nested value nestedParam (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the "Composite Generator" generator listed on the "Select a Generator" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the "Composite Generator.generator/NestedGenerator" generator listed on the "Select a Generator" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) When I select the "Composite Generator" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the "Configure Params" dialog (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the "commonParam" parameter to fill (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the "commonParam" value already filled with "Composite value" (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the "compositeParam" parameter to fill (NOT PERFORMED) And I will see the "nestedParam" parameter to fill (NOT PERFORMED) When I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "NestedGenerator.txt" generated with content: Composite value (NOT PERFORMED)

testcase.system-out:
Story: Set template engine for the templates config file
As a Developer I want to use template engines on templates config files So that I have processed template destinations
Scenario: Set Freemarker as template engine for the templates config file
Given I have a new project When I create the generator folder "generators/Using Freemarker on the templates config file.generator" And I create the template file "generators/Using Freemarker on the templates config file.generator/templates/UsingFreemarkerOnThemplatesConfigFile.txt.ftl" (FAILED) And I create the templates configuration file "generators/Using Freemarker on the templates config file.generator/templates.ftl" with contents: templates/UsingFreemarkerOnThemplatesConfigFile.txt.ftl=<#assign processedDestination="Using Freemarker on the templates config file.txt"/>${processedDestination} (NOT PERFORMED) And I right click the project on the Package Explorer and select "Generate..." (NOT PERFORMED) And I select the "Using Freemarker on the templates config file" generator and click "Next" (NOT PERFORMED) And I finish the "Generate Files" wizard (NOT PERFORMED) Then I will see the file "Using Freemarker on the templates config file.txt" generated (NOT PERFORMED)
